intro: Ailuroschia galactites, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring thick, fleshy stems that store water. Its flowers are typically borne in dense, star-like clusters, giving it its common name. Ailuroschia galactites is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
